Chapter 58 – Abhorrence of repelling the beggar

titles.ar: بَابُ الصَّدَقَةِ عَلَى مَنْ لَا تَعْرِفُهُ
titles.en: Chapter 56 – The charity upon the one whom one does not recognise

titles.ar: بَابُ الصَّدَقَةِ عَلَى أَهْلِ الْبَوَادِي وَ أَهْلِ السَّوَادِ
titles.en: Chapter 57 – The charity upon the people of the valleys and the people of the wilderness

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (16/141)
text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ بَزِيعٍ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عُذَافِرٍ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الصَّدَقَةِ عَلَى أَهْلِ الْبَوَادِي وَ السَّوَادِ فَقَالَ تَصَدَّقْ عَلَى الصِّبْيَانِ وَ النِّسَاءِ وَ الزَّمْنَى وَ الضُّعَفَاءِ وَ الشُّيُوخِ وَ كَانَ يَنْهَى عَنْ أُولَئِكَ الْجُمَّانِينَ يَعْنِي أَصْحَابَ الشُّعُورِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Ismail Bin Bazie, or someone else, from Muhammad Bin Uzafar, from Umar Bin Yazeed who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about the charity upon the people of the valleys and the wilderness, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Give charity upon the children, and the women, and the sick, and the weak, and the old’; and he<sup>asws</sup> had forbidden from those who are able, meaning the ones with the (earning) capacity’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn Isma‘il ibn Bazi’ or someone other than him from Muhammad ibn ‘Adhafir from ‘Umar ibn Yazid who has said the following: “I asked abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about giving charity to the Bedouins and people who live in remote areas. He replied, ‘Give charity to their children, women and people suffering from chronic illness, the weak and the old.’ He prohibited giving charity to those with big hairs (meaning thereby people hostile to ’A’immah).’’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (16/141)
text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الصَّلْتِ عَنْ زُرْعَةَ عَنْ مِنْهَالٍ الْقَصَّابِ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَعْطِ الْكَبِيرَ وَ الْكَبِيرَةَ وَ الصَّغِيرَ وَ الصَّغِيرَةَ وَ مَنْ وَقَعَتْ لَهُ فِي قَلْبِكَ رَحْمَةٌ وَ إِيَّاكَ وَ كُلَّ وَ قَالَ بِيَدِهِ وَ هَزَّهَا .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Salt, from Zur’at, from Minhal Al Qassab who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Give to the old man and the old women, and the young boy and the young girl, and to the ones for whom mercy occurs in your heart; and beware of (giving to) everyone . . . .’; and gestured by shaking his<sup>asws</sup> hand’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from Ali ibn al-Salt from Zur‘ah, from Minhal al-Qassab who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Give charity to old men and women, small boys and girls, and to whomever you sympathize with; never give charity to those . . he moved his hand as if shaking something off his hand (a reference to those hostile to ’A’immah).”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول ويحتمل الضعف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (16/141)
text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنِ الْحَكَمِ بْنِ مِسْكِينٍ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ أَهْلَ السَّوَادِ يَقْتَحِمُونَ عَلَيْنَا وَ فِيهِمُ الْيَهُودُ وَ النَّصَارَى وَ الْمَجُوسُ فَنَتَصَدَّقُ عَلَيْهِمْ فَقَالَ نَعَمْ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Ali Bin Al Hakam Bin Miskeen, from Amro Bin Abu Nasr who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The people of the wilderness are swooping upon us, and among them are the Jews, and the Christians, and the Magians, so can we give charity to them?’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ali from al-Hakam ibn Miskin from ‘Amr ibn abu Nasr who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, ‘People who live in wilderness come to us.
